argument.description: The base used in the calculation.
The exponent used in the calculation.

returnType: The POWER function returns a numeric value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL POWER function returns m raised to the nth power.
sample:
POWER(3, 2)
Result: 9

POWER(5, 3)
Result: 125

POWER(-5, 3)
Result: -125

POWER(6.2, 3)
Result: 238.328

POWER(6.2, 3.5)
Result: 593.431934277892
